main event: On July 25, 1952, a disc-shaped, bright white object was observed visually for approximately one and a half hours by Ground Observer Corps personnel near San Raphael, California. It traveled at an estimated speed of 150 M.P.H. at an altitude between 10,000 and 20,000 feet. The observers suggested it may have been an astronomical light possibly coming from the middle of the object.
interesting points: The object was observed for a significant duration of one and a half hours, allowing for detailed visual examination.
The observers described the object as disc-shaped and bright white in color, moving at a speed of 150 M.P.H. at high altitude.
One of the observers speculated that the object may have been an astronomical light possibly emanating from the middle of the object, introducing an intriguing interpretation of the sighting.
Weather and control center reports indicated the involvement of jet aircraft in investigating the sighting, but no contact was made.
The reporting officer's opinion leaned towards the object being an astronomical light or instrument, with extreme altitude and speed not characteristic of known aircraft.
witnesses: S/Sgt. George G. Owens (USAF retired) and Sgt. Nicholas Martucci
